Question.title: Post-Operative diangosis same as pre-operative diagnosis

Question.title: Re-operation on a previously operated side

Question.title: Was pre-operative chemotherapy given for this malignancy?

Question.title: Describe chemotherapy treatment, reasons and results:

Question.title: Was pre-operative radiotherapy given for this malignancy?

Question.title: Describe radiotherapy treatment, reasons and results:

Question.title: FEV1% predicted pre-op: Litres Per Minute

ListItem.name: LI_76803
ListItem.title: Tx Primary tumor cannot be assessed, or tumor proven by the presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy

ListItem.name: LI_76804
ListItem.title: T0 No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_76806
ListItem.title: T1 Tumor 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung of visceral pleura, without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (for example, not in the main bronchus)

ListItem.name: LI_76807
ListItem.title: T1a Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_76808
ListItem.title: T1b Tumor more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_76809
ListItem.title: T2 Tumor with more than 3 cm but 7 cm or less or tumor with any of the following features (T2 tumors with these features are classified T2a if 5 cm or less); Involves main bronchus, 2cm o more distal to the carina; invades visceral pleura (PL1 or PL2); associated the atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis that extends to the hilar region but does not involve the entire lung

ListItem.name: LI_76810
ListItem.title: T2a Tumor more than 3cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_76811
ListItem.title: T2b Tumor more than 5 cm but 7 cm or less in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_76812
ListItem.title: T3 Tumor more than 7 cm or one that directly invades any of the following: parietal pleura (PL3), chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), diaphragm, phrenic nerve, mediastinal pleura, parietal pericardium; or tumor in the main bronchus less than 2 cm distal to the carina but without involvement of the carina; or associated atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis of the entire lung or a separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe

ListItem.name: LI_76813
ListItem.title: T4 Tumor of any size that invades any of the following: mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, recurrent laryngeal nerve, esophagus, vertebral body, carina, separate tumor nodule(s) in a different ipsilateral lobe

ListItem.name: LI_76814
ListItem.title: Nx Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_76815
ListItem.title: N0 No regional lymph node metastases

ListItem.name: LI_76816
ListItem.title: N1 Metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar nodes and intrapulmonary nodes including involvement by direct extension

ListItem.name: LI_76817
ListItem.title: N2 Metastasis in ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_76818
ListItem.title: N3 Metastasis in contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_76821
ListItem.title: M1a Separate tumor nodule(s) in a contralateral lobe, tumor with pleural nodules or malignant pleural (or pericardial) effusion
